post_text:
Labor Day, the first Monday in September, is a creation of the labor movement and is dedicated to the social and economic achievements of American workers. It constitutes a yearly national tribute to the contributions workers have made to the strength, prosperity, and well-being of our country.
We would like to let everyone know that City Hall will be closed Monday 7th, 2020. We hope everyone has a great and safe Labor Day Weekend.

post_text:
The Declaration of Independence.
We celebrate American Independence Day on the Fourth of July every year. We think of July 4, 1776, as a day that represents the Declaration of Independence and the birth of the United States of America as an independent nation. Hope everyone has a fun and safe time.

post_text: Graduation day brings with it a roller coaster of emotions for grads and their families alike. It’s a time of celebration and achievement. There is reflection on past trials and successes as well as hope for the future. The City of Baxley and Appling County Board of Commissioners have come together to proclaim, May 22nd 2020, to be a day of recognition for our Graduating Class of 2020. Congratulations Class of 2020!!!

post_text: You’re invited to participate in a “Drive-by Convoy” to support the front-line workers, patients, and residents of Appling Healthcare and the Pavilion! Feel free to create signs of encouragement! Participants should meet at the Baxley City Pool parking lot at 5:30 p.m. Monday, May 4th. Everyone should remain in their vehicles for safety purposes. The Appling County Ministerial Alliance will be holding a prayer service following the convoy at 6:00 pm. Let’s continue to show love and support for community in any way we can!

The Appling County Ministerial Alliance will be holding a prayer service following the convoy at 6:00 pm. Let’s continue to show love and support for community in any way we can!

shared_text:
The Baxley News-Banner
March 19 at 11:29 AM ·

NOTICE FROM THE CITY OF BAXLEY...

Due to rising concerns of the COVID-19 virus, the City of Baxley has elected to close the lobby of City Hall until further notice. The drive-thru will still be available for payments during normal business hours (Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.). The drop box at the drive-thru window is also available for your convenience. If your problem/concern can be handled by phone or to make an appointment for a meeting, please call 912-367-8300.

Reid Lovett, Baxley City Manager

post_text: Mayor Tim Varnadore showed up to one of the DAR meetings, he spoke on a few good topics on The Daughters of the American Revolution (DAR), which is a lineage-based membership service organization for women who are directly descended from a person involved in the United States' efforts towards independence. A non-profit group, they promote historic preservation, education, and patriotism.

post_text: URGENT NOTICE: Ryland trash truck will be running a truck today due to the weather updates. If your normal pick up day was Tuesday, he will pick up today (Wednesday), if your can is not picked up today, let us know, we will send a truck back by tomorrow. Thursday and Friday routes should be picked up on normal route days. We apologize for any confusion and inconvenience. Please make sure to secure your can during the weather. If you have any questions, please feel free to call City Hall 912-367-8300.

shared_text:
WBYZ94.COM
Alzheimer’s Patient Goes Missing in Baxley
text:
WBYZ94.COM
Alzheimer’s Patient Goes Missing in Baxley

shared_text:
Mark Melton, Sheriff of Appling County
August 3, 2019 at 9:10 AM ·

ATTENTION APPLING AND SURROUNDING COUNTIES:

Be on the lookout for an elderly white male, James (Jim) Zerkle. Mr. Zerkle is an Alzheimer patient, 80 years old, 5' 10", 162 lbs., Hazel eyes, and grey hair. Subject wandered off from his home at 164 Plier Street, Baxley, at approximately 1:00 pm on Friday, August 2. Mr. Zerkle's son advised he was wearing blue/grey shorts and a yellow button down shirt. Subject has a GPS on his shirt collar that is not charged. He was traveling on foot and is very confused. His whereabouts are unknown.

Any contact with this subject, please hold and notify the Baxley Police Department at 912-367-8105 or the Appling County Sheriff's Office at 912-367-8111.

post_text: If you missed our last City Council meeting, we have some fun and exciting news!! Coming up is a game between our Appling County Pirates and Jeff Davis Yellow Jackets on August 16th 2019. Mayor Varnadore of Baxley and Mayor Stone of Hazlehurst have decided to make it interesting. If the Pirates win, the Pirate flag will be flown in front of City Hall in Hazlehurst for one solid week, if the Yellow Jackets should prevail, their flag will be flown in front of City Hall in Baxley for one solid week. We ask that our community please join in support of our football team. But lets not forget to bring the football spirit for both teams. Goooooo Pirates!!!!!
text: If you missed our last City Council meeting, we have some fun and exciting news!! Coming up is a game between our Appling County Pirates and Jeff Davis Yellow Jackets on August 16th 2019. Mayor Varnadore of Baxley and Mayor Stone of Hazlehurst have decided to make it interesting. If the Pirates win, the Pirate flag will be flown in front of City Hall in Hazlehurst for one solid week, if the Yellow Jackets should prevail, their flag will be flown in front of City Hall in Baxley for one solid week. We ask that our community please join in support of our football team. But lets not forget to bring the football spirit for both teams. Goooooo Pirates!!!!!

City Hall of Baxley Georgia added 25 new photos.
May 14, 2019 at 11:19 AM ·

On Tuesday May 14th, we had our 8th graders come down to City Hall to put on a Mock City Council. From each team, there were 10 students chosen to play each part in the council. Each team had an agenda and had to discuss the pros and cons on each topic. We here at the City Hall want to thank each one of you because you all did a GREAT job!!!Good luck in your future and we hope to see some of those faces return.

City Hall of Baxley Georgia added 14 new photos — in Baxley, Georgia.
May 14, 2019 at 10:51 AM · Baxley, GA ·

On May 8th 2019, we had four 6th graders that were chosen to read their essays in front of the Council and also come back for a luncheon. The overall winner Jordan Hester also received a $50.00 check from the City of Baxley. Our 3 other winners were Carlee Hutcheson from team 6-1, Jaden Dubberly from team 6-2, and Amelia Lott from team 6-3. We want to congratulate you all and also thank you to each student that participated.

On May 8th 2019, we had four 6th graders that were chosen to read their essays in front of the Council and also come back for a luncheon. The overall winner Jordan Hester also received a $50.00 check from the City of Baxley. Our 3 other winners were Carlee Hutcheson from team 6-1, Jaden Dubberly from team 6-2, and Amelia Lott from team 6-3. We want to congratulate you all and also thank you to each student that participated.

post_text: Thank you to all our Law Enforcement in what you do! We appreciate it more than any of you will know. Stay safe!!
shared_text:
Ashley Sharpe White
December 1, 2018 at 8:53 AM ·

Since I opened my salon I have arrived at work several times to these little notes tucked into my door. As I business owner and a not very big women it gives me a great feeling of peace knowing that even when I am not here our local Police are checking up to make sure that things are okay. Especially in the world we live in it is so nice to know that my business is being looked after, even throughout the night and monitored. Just within the past week I have received 2 of these. This morning when I got here a few minutes before 7 and it was still dark and no one else was on this street I pulled up and noticed this tucked in my door. It just makes you feel safer. So thank you to our local police! I appreciate all that you do! Y’all rock!
text:
Thank you to all our Law Enforcement in what you do! We appreciate it more than any of you will know. Stay safe!!

shared_text:
Baxley/Appling County Chamber of Commerce is with Keri Crosby Orvin.
November 5, 2018 at 3:32 PM ·

It is officially Appling County Bicentennial Festival week. The Appling Board of Commissioners and City of Baxley have proclaimed this Thursday, November 8th as Appling County Bicentennial T-shirt day! Show your support for the county’s bicentennial anniversary with your very own commemorative T-shirt to sport on Thursday! Shirts are available in red, white and blue as you see below and can be purchased for $15 at the Chamber of Commerce! We are super excited about our festival events starting on Friday and hope you will join the community to celebrate this awesome milestone! Shirts are available in youth extra small through adult 3X! Get yours today!

post_text:
School Closed Friday

Due to low hanging power lines, downed trees, and power outages, Appling County School System will be CLOSED for staff and students on Friday, October 12, 2018. Constant conversation has been conducted between the school system, county officials, and the EMA in order to make these decisions. Extracurricular events will be coordinated through the Athletic Director and Principal of the designated school.

post_text: Fair Street had its official opening Friday, August 31st. Thanks to everyone of the City of Baxley!!!!

post_text: Notice to the public!! It has come to our attention that private contractors are going door to door soliciting water sample service for a fee. This is NOT a City of Baxley contractor or employee. The City of Baxley performs our routine water samples during our daily schedules at our sampling points at no direct fee to our customers. If you have any questions please feel free to give us a call at the City Hall (912-367-8300) or the Public Works (912-367-8314).

post_text: Sorry for any inconvenience, but due to the weather conditions and all the rain fall, some of our trash routes has not been able to be completed. They will continue and try again in the morning. If you have any questions please call us at City Hall 912-367-8300. Thank you!!
